lines.text: Enter LUCIO and two Gentlemen

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: If the duke with the other dukes come not to composition with the King of Hungary, why then all the dukes fall upon the king.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Heaven grant us its peace, but not the King of Hungary's!

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: Amen.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Thou concludest like the sanctimonious pirate, that went to sea with the Ten Commandments, but scraped one out of the table.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: 'Thou shalt not steal'?

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Ay, that he razed.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Why, 'twas a commandment to command the captain and all the rest from their functions: they put forth to steal. There's not a soldier of us all, that, in the thanksgiving before meat, do relish the petition well that prays for peace.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: I never heard any soldier dislike it.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: I believe thee; for I think thou never wast where grace was said.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: No? a dozen times at least.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: What, in metre?

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: In any proportion or in any language.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: I think, or in any religion.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Ay, why not? Grace is grace, despite of all controversy: as, for example, thou thyself art a wicked villain, despite of all grace.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Well, there went but a pair of shears between us.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: I grant; as there may between the lists and the velvet. Thou art the list.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: And thou the velvet: thou art good velvet; thou'rt a three-piled piece, I warrant thee: I had as lief be a list of an English kersey as be piled, as thou art piled, for a French velvet. Do I speak feelingly now?

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: I think thou dost; and, indeed, with most painful feeling of thy speech: I will, out of thine own confession, learn to begin thy health; but, whilst I live, forget to drink after thee.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: I think I have done myself wrong, have I not?

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: Yes, that thou hast, whether thou art tainted or free.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Behold, behold. where Madam Mitigation comes! I have purchased as many diseases under her roof as come to--

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: To what, I pray?

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Judge.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: To three thousand dolours a year.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Ay, and more.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: A French crown more.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Thou art always figuring diseases in me; but thou art full of error; I am sound.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Nay, not as one would say, healthy; but so sound as things that are hollow: thy bones are hollow; impiety has made a feast of thee.
Enter MISTRESS OVERDONE

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: How now! which of your hips has the most profound sciatica?

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: Well, well; there's one yonder arrested and carried to prison was worth five thousand of you all.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: Who's that, I pray thee?

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: Marry, sir, that's Claudio, Signior Claudio.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: Claudio to prison? 'tis not so.

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: Nay, but I know 'tis so: I saw him arrested, saw him carried away; and, which is more, within these three days his head to be chopped off.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: But, after all this fooling, I would not have it so. Art thou sure of this?

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: I am too sure of it: and it is for getting Madam Julietta with child.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Believe me, this may be: he promised to meet me two hours since, and he was ever precise in promise-keeping.

lines.speaker: second gentleman
lines.text: Besides, you know, it draws something near to the speech we had to such a purpose.

lines.speaker: first gentleman
lines.text: But, most of all, agreeing with the proclamation.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Away! let's go learn the truth of it.
Exeunt LUCIO and Gentlemen

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: Thus, what with the war, what with the sweat, what with the gallows and what with poverty, I am custom-shrunk. How now! what's the news with you?
Enter POMPEY

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Yonder man is carried to prison.

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: Well; what has he done?

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: A woman.

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: But what's his offence?

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Groping for trouts in a peculiar river.

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: What, is there a maid with child by him?

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: No, but there's a woman with maid by him. You have not heard of the proclamation, have you?

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: What proclamation, man?

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: All houses in the suburbs of Vienna must be plucked down.

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: And what shall become of those in the city?

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: They shall stand for seed: they had gone down too, but that a wise burgher put in for them.

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: But shall all our houses of resort in the suburbs be pulled down?

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: To the ground, mistress.

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: Why, here's a change indeed in the commonwealth! What shall become of me?

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Come; fear you not: good counsellors lack no clients: though you change your place, you need not change your trade; I'll be your tapster still. Courage! there will be pity taken on you: you that have worn your eyes almost out in the service, you will be considered.

lines.speaker: mistress overdone
lines.text: What's to do here, Thomas tapster? let's withdraw.

lines.speaker: pompey
lines.text: Here comes Signior Claudio, led by the provost to prison; and there's Madam Juliet.
Exeunt
Enter Provost, CLAUDIO, JULIET, and Officers

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: Fellow, why dost thou show me thus to the world? Bear me to prison, where I am committed.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: I do it not in evil disposition, But from Lord Angelo by special charge.

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: Thus can the demigod Authority Make us pay down for our offence by weight The words of heaven; on whom it will, it will; On whom it will not, so; yet still 'tis just.
Re-enter LUCIO and two Gentlemen

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Why, how now, Claudio! whence comes this restraint?

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: From too much liberty, my Lucio, liberty: As surfeit is the father of much fast, So every scope by the immoderate use Turns to restraint. Our natures do pursue, Like rats that ravin down their proper bane, A thirsty evil; and when we drink we die.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: If could speak so wisely under an arrest, I would send for certain of my creditors: and yet, to say the truth, I had as lief have the foppery of freedom as the morality of imprisonment. What's thy offence, Claudio?

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: What but to speak of would offend again.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: What, is't murder?

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Lechery?

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: Call it so.

lines.speaker: provost
lines.text: Away, sir! you must go.

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: One word, good friend. Lucio, a word with you.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: A hundred, if they'll do you any good. Is lechery so look'd after?

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: Thus stands it with me: upon a true contract I got possession of Julietta's bed: You know the lady; she is fast my wife, Save that we do the denunciation lack Of outward order: this we came not to, Only for propagation of a dower Remaining in the coffer of her friends, From whom we thought it meet to hide our love Till time had made them for us. But it chances The stealth of our most mutual entertainment With character too gross is writ on Juliet.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: With child, perhaps?

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: Unhappily, even so. And the new deputy now for the duke-- Whether it be the fault and glimpse of newness, Or whether that the body public be A horse whereon the governor doth ride, Who, newly in the seat, that it may know He can command, lets it straight feel the spur; Whether the tyranny be in his place, Or in his emmence that fills it up, I stagger in:--but this new governor Awakes me all the enrolled penalties Which have, like unscour'd armour, hung by the wall So long that nineteen zodiacs have gone round And none of them been worn; and, for a name, Now puts the drowsy and neglected act Freshly on me: 'tis surely for a name.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: I warrant it is: and thy head stands so tickle on thy shoulders that a milkmaid, if she be in love, may sigh it off. Send after the duke and appeal to him.

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: I have done so, but he's not to be found. I prithee, Lucio, do me this kind service: This day my sister should the cloister enter And there receive her approbation: Acquaint her with the danger of my state: Implore her, in my voice, that she make friends To the strict deputy; bid herself assay him: I have great hope in that; for in her youth There is a prone and speechless dialect, Such as move men; beside, she hath prosperous art When she will play with reason and discourse, And well she can persuade.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: I pray she may; as well for the encouragement of the like, which else would stand under grievous imposition, as for the enjoying of thy life, who I would be sorry should be thus foolishly lost at a game of tick-tack. I'll to her.

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: I thank you, good friend Lucio.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Within two hours.

lines.speaker: claudio
lines.text: Come, officer, away!
Exeunt
